sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: Technical Reactions to FOA Trends in Macro Strategies
feed.summary: This article analyzes Finance Of America Companies Inc. Class A (NYSE: FOA) using AI models, highlighting a weak near-term sentiment with a significant risk-reward short setup. It outlines specific trading strategies (Position, Momentum Breakout, Risk Hedging) and provides multi-timeframe signal analysis, suggesting neutral sentiment for mid- and long-term horizons. The piece emphasizes institutional trading strategies and offers real-time signals and personalized alerts for subscribers.

feed.title: Finance of America Companies (NYSE:FOA) CAO Tai Thornock Sells 1,100 Shares
feed.summary: Finance of America Companies (NYSE:FOA) Chief Accounting Officer Tai Thornock sold 1,100 shares of the company's stock on December 16th, for a total of $25,344. This transaction reduced Thornock's stake by 8.56% to 11,750 shares. The company's stock traded up 0.4% to $23.08 on Thursday, with previous analyst ratings resulting in a consensus "Hold" and an average price target of $29.75.

feed.title: Finance of America closes $50M preferred stock deal
feed.summary: Finance of America Companies (FOA) has successfully closed a deal to sell 50,000 shares of its Series A Convertible Perpetual Preferred Stock for $50 million to investment funds managed by Blue Owl Alternative Credit Advisors LLC. This transaction, which included a Registration Rights Agreement and a subsidiary structure adjustment, aims to strengthen FOA's capital structure and enhance its market positioning through collaboration with Blue Owl. Despite facing significant financial challenges like declining revenues and profitability issues, this strategic move highlights the company's efforts towards future growth.

feed.title: Tactical Opportunit Blackstone Sells 1,596,142 Shares of Finance of America Companies (NYSE:FOA) Stock
feed.summary: Tactical Opportunit Blackstone significantly reduced its stake in Finance of America Companies (NYSE:FOA) by selling 1,596,142 shares for approximately $15.96 million on December 4th, representing a 99.86% decrease in ownership. Following the sale, Tactical Opportunit Blackstone now owns 2,161 shares. Finance of America Companies Inc. shares traded up 0.9% to $22.72, with a market capitalization of $179.22 million and institutional ownership around 97.20%.

feed.title: Blackstone funds sell Finance of America (FOA) shares worth $15.9 million
feed.summary: Blackstone Inc. and affiliated funds sold 1,596,142 shares of Finance of America Companies Inc. (NASDAQ:FOA) for $15.9 million on December 4, 2025, at a price of $10 per share. Despite the sale, FOA currently trades at $22.72, and InvestingPro analysis suggests the stock is undervalued. This comes amidst strong Q3 2025 financial results for Finance of America and an acquisition deal for PHH Mortgage Corporation’s reverse mortgage assets.

feed.title: Blackstone sells Finance of America (FOA) shares worth $15.9 million

feed.title: Blackstone funds sell Finance of America (FOA) shares worth $15.9 million

feed.title: Blackstone sells Finance of America (FOA) shares worth $15.9 million
feed.summary: Blackstone entities sold over 1.5 million shares of Finance of America Companies Inc. (NYSE:FOA) Class A Common Stock and 2.4 million LLC Units for $10 each, totaling nearly $16 million, even though FOA currently trades at $22.72. feed.title: Finance of America (FOA) 10% owners sell $15.9 million in stock
feed.summary: Ten percent owners of Finance of America Companies Inc. (NYSE:FOA), including BTO Urban Holdings L.L.C. and Blackstone Tactical Opportunities Funds, sold $15.9 million worth of Class A Common Stock and LLC Units on December 4, 2025. The sales were conducted at $10.0 per share, significantly below the current trading price. Despite these sales and past stock volatility, analysts anticipate FOA will become profitable this year, and the company recently reported strong Q3 2025 results and announced an acquisition of PHH Mortgage Corporation’s reverse mortgage assets.

feed.title: Kristen Sieffert Sells 750 Shares of Finance of America Companies (NYSE:FOA) Stock
feed.summary: Kristen Sieffert, President of Finance of America Companies (NYSE:FOA), sold 750 shares of the company's stock at an average price of $23.50, totaling $17,625.00. This transaction, dated December 1st, reduced her stake by 0.92%, leaving her with 81,049 shares. The company's stock traded up 1.3% to $23.45 on Wednesday, and institutional investors own 97.20% of FOA shares.

feed.title: Eric Jackson Says This Mortgage Finance Stock Could Soar 21,200% Over The Next 3 Years: 'Mathematically Plausible'
feed.summary: Hedge fund manager Eric Jackson predicts a 21,200% surge for Better Home & Finance Holding Co. (NASDAQ: BETR) over the next three years, calling it "mathematically plausible." He bases this aggressive forecast on the company's "Tinman" data platform and "Betsy" AI automation layer, which he compares to Palantir's enterprise ontology. Jackson highlights revenue growth, increased funded volumes, and a rapidly expanding home equity line of credit (HELOC) business as indicators of its potential.

feed.title: FOA unit FAR to buy PHH reverse mortgage loans and servicing
feed.summary: Finance of America Companies Inc. (FOA), through its subsidiary Finance of America Reverse LLC (FAR), has agreed to acquire the residential reverse mortgage loan origination and servicing business assets and liabilities from PHH Mortgage Corporation. The deal involves FAR purchasing a portfolio of residential reverse mortgage loans and servicing rights for an amount equal to the estimated book value, subject to adjustments. PHH will also act as FAR's subservicer for three years post-closing, with options for extensions, pending regulatory approvals like that from Government National Mortgage Association.

feed.title: Finance Of America Companies Inc. (NYSE:FOA) Q3 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
feed.summary: Finance of America (NYSE: FOA) reported strong Q3 2025 earnings, with adjusted net income more than doubling year-over-year to $33 million, or $1.33 per share, significantly exceeding expectations. The company showcased strategic execution through liquidity enhancement transactions, including a $2 billion securitization and plans to repurchase Blackstone's equity stake. FOA is focusing on digital innovation and AI to drive operational efficiency and expects continued volume growth and increased adjusted EPS in 2026.

feed.title: Earnings call transcript: Finance of America sees strong Q3 2025 growth
feed.summary: Finance of America (FOA) reported strong Q3 2025 financial results, with GAAP net income of $131 million and adjusted net income of $33 million, driven by increased funded volumes and operational improvements. The company is actively focusing on digital innovation, AI integration, and market expansion, leading to a positive outlook with projected volume growth of 20-25% annually and a significant increase in adjusted EPS for 2026. Despite potential market challenges, FOA aims to solidify its position in the home equity solutions market through strategic partnerships and technological advancements.

feed.title: Finance of America announces repurchase of Blackstone equity stake, repayment of working capital facility
feed.summary: Finance of America recently announced the repurchase of Blackstone's equity stake in the company and the repayment of its working capital facility. This move marks a significant restructuring for Finance of America, potentially increasing its financial independence and operational flexibility. The company aims to strengthen its position in the market following these strategic financial maneuvers.

feed.title: Finance of America Companies (FOA) to Release Quarterly Earnings on Tuesday
feed.summary: Finance of America Companies (FOA) is scheduled to release its Q3 2025 earnings on Tuesday, November 4th, with analysts projecting earnings of $0.6710 per share and revenue of $101.91 million. The stock currently has an average consensus rating of "Hold" from analysts, with a target price of $27.50, and has shown significant insider selling activity.

feed.title: Better.com to power Finance of America’s new home equity products - Investing.com Canada
feed.summary: The article indicates an application error prevented the main content from loading. However, the title suggests a partnership where Better.com will power Finance of America's new home equity products. This intended news would likely detail the collaboration and the offerings.

feed.title: Morningstar DBRS Publishes Residential Reverse Mortgage Originator Ranking Report on Finance of America Reverse LLC - MarketScreener
feed.summary: Morningstar DBRS published its residential reverse mortgage originator ranking report on Finance of America Reverse LLC (FAR), confirming its MOR RVO2 ranking with a Stable trend. FAR, a subsidiary of Finance of America Equity Capital LLC, specializes in reverse mortgages, including HUD-insured HECM products and proprietary HomeSafe loans. In 2024, FAR originated over $1.9 billion in reverse mortgages, and $560 million in the first three months of 2025.

feed.title: Finance of America Repurchases Blackstone’s Equity Stake
feed.summary: Finance of America Companies (FOA) has completed the repurchase of Blackstone's equity stake and repaid its working capital facility, marking a key strategic step. The company also secured a new convertible debt facility with existing institutional investors to enhance its financial position and support growth. These moves aim to strengthen the balance sheet, reduce costs, and position FOA for future value creation, despite a "Neutral" rating from TipRanks' AI Analyst, Spark, citing financial instability and valuation concerns.

feed.title: Finance of America Announces Expected Effective Date of July 25, 2024 for Reverse Stock Split
feed.summary: Finance of America Companies Inc. (NYSE: FOA) announced that its 1-for-10 reverse stock split of Class A Common Stock is expected to be effective on July 25, 2024, at 5:00 p.m. Eastern Time. Trading on a split-adjusted basis will commence on the NYSE under the existing symbol FOA on July 26, 2024. This action is primarily aimed at increasing the per-share trading price to meet NYSE listing criteria.

feed.title: Finance of America CFO resigns, Engel to assume role in November
feed.summary: Finance of America Companies (FOA) announced the resignation of its CFO, Johan Gericke, effective October 13, 2023. FOA CEO Graham Fleming will serve as interim CFO until November 15, when Matt Engel, former CFO of American Advisors Group (AAG), will officially take over the role. Engel brings extensive reverse mortgage industry experience to FOA.

feed.title: Finance Of America Mortgage To Shut Down
feed.summary: Finance of America Companies Inc. has decided to shut down its retail mortgage division, Finance of America Mortgage LLC, after a deal to sell it fell through. The closure will result in pre-tax charges of approximately $145 million to $164 million, with an estimated $15 million to $26 million in cash expenditures. This move is part of a "Resource Optimization Plan" to focus on its reverse mortgage, commercial mortgage, lender services, and portfolio management segments, aiming for annualized savings of $110 million to $120 million.

feed.title: Finance Of America Companies To Acquire Certain Assets Of Parkside Lending
feed.summary: Finance of America Companies Inc. announced its mortgage originations subsidiary, Finance of America Mortgage LLC, plans to acquire certain assets of Parkside Lending LLC for approximately $40 million. This acquisition is expected to significantly increase FAM’s third-party origination coverage by adding over 1,000 seasoned brokers and aims to position FAM's wholesale business among the top five in its segment. The move aligns with Finance of America's strategy of acquiring complementary businesses to drive growth and improve operating performance.
